comments.commentBody:
In California many work for labor contractors that hire out to agricultural companies. Many of them live with relatives in places like Salinas. the bus picks them up, takes them to the fields, the get paid by the amount they harvest, the contractor collects from the farmer, he pays the workers. Without these workers the east coast would not get many products from the fields. They have to work hard and fast to make enough to pay rent and send some home.

We see comment here all the time as to how Americans would do the jobs if paid better, showing ignorance of the work and travel required. When one crop is harvested, they have to move on to another, strawberries and apples ripen at different times and in different places, as do the truck crops in Imperial county. My gardener had five crews until a couple of years ago but the undocumented ones left. They spent, bought pickups, groceries, clothing, electronics, all contributing to the economy. My uncle had an apricot farm, he had to tear out the trees when he could not pickers any more.

A lot of those affordable tract homes were built by them, that was what made them affordable. People complained about the illegals, but bought the homes. Now isn't that hypocritical?

Note how with all this talk of a wall Mexico does not say anything about the problem that so many of its citizens illegally enter our country, or do anything to stop it.

I have heard talk of a wall (usually called a fence) on the Mexico border since Bill Clinton ran on that platform in 1992. Eight and then four years ago Mitt Romney often talked about the need for a fence to finally control our southern border. Congress even passed the Secure Fence Act of 2008 which was supposed to finally secure our border. It was partly built (and of course partly doesn't help).

But now somehow when Donald Trump does get serious about building a wall that is terribly offensive to the Mexican people?

I can understand how this puts Enrique Pena Nieto in a bind, and wish there were some way to soften the blow. And Donald Trump should not keep saying that Mexico is going to pay for the wall -- of course they are not and that's a low blow that helps no one.

But I cannot see why the Democrats in the United States think that we should allow people and goods to illegally cross our southern border, and that people who are in our country illegally should be allowed to stay. I applaud Donald Trump's actions.

And I hope that Enrique Pena Nieto does show up. I think a dialogue between the two men will help a lot. Donald Trump tweets like a tiger and signs documents that are harsh. But in person he is more of a pussycat. (As Mitt Romney found out.)

Bill Clinton did not run on the platform of placing a wall ( or fence) along the border. I am pretty sure Mitt Romney didn't either though I can't guarantee it.
It is not true that "the Democrats in the United States think that we should allow people and goods to illegally cross our southern border". The Democrats just don't see why we should kick people out of our country who were brought here as small children without the slightest clue what was happening. We also don't see why we should send people back to their country when they will very likely be killed by the dictators who have taken over their countries.
First get your facts straight, then maybe we will even agree with one another.
Narcissistic sociopaths like Trump can turn the charm on and of like a light switch. Trump is a brilliant user, and a fraud. Reap the Whirlwind, red states!
Most aren'y children and Mexico is not a dictatorship.
The wall is a giant prop in Trump's political theater. And the show is all he cares about.

Are you OK then with a open border from Mexico allowing poor immigrants who's offspring would automatically become US citizens using our tax money to pay for their hospital services. How do you justify illegal immigration into our country where I've read Mexico deports any illegals caught into Mexico the same day?.

Why would Pena Nieto allow himself to be used, once again, as a prop by the Trump campaign.  Does the man never learn?? Trump is not interested in a dialogue with him.  Trump could care less what Nieto says to him.  The sole purpose of this meeting is so that Trump can stand beside the Mexican president while he trashes Mexico and Mexican-American immigrants in an effort to appease his rabid, racist base.

Oh right, that's certainly true because agent 777 tells us.  The U.S. should just dispense with all trade agreements entirely and rely only on what we produce locally!  It's always worked before, right?  Yup, gotta listen to Truth when it comes with a lucky number and a vast array of statistics to back the claim up.

and Elke
No problem getting to print out on A-L tonight. I am west of MISSOURI.
On first run through puzzle got all the way down to (CROW)N ROYAL before I got a "hit". By coincidence, my blue felt bag holds my birding binoculars and a Golden Field Guide "Birds of North America". Both well used.
Then I worked my way back to get BAL(LOON)IST and FRA(TERN)ITY. Did need aid on TE LA(WREN)CE .
Agree with MTFTobin- would not consider LOONs, TERNs or even CROWs "LITTLE BIRDIES". I mentioned yesterday hummingbirds- they are LITTLE; so are "t*ts" and chickadees, and, yes, WRENs.
GEE, THO , on the other hand, CROWs have been caught trying to talk, so in keeping with the theme ....
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YZ0yrG-Yz88

I continue to be AMAZED at the clever themes with which puzzle constructors come up . This one certainly was UPTEMPO and FINE.
Now for some ice cream in a CUP to celebrate catching on to a rebus early.

PS- deadline- glad you're back. A speedy recovery.

Thank you.

xxx

Well, Trump has already assured himself a legacy...

"Monument to lies" is an epic way of describing the wall. Should the useless (hello ladders and tunnels) wall survive, future generations will actually be writing on it all the lies a US President once told Americans. I'm pretty sure Trump can continue mouthing off and fill the entire 2,000 miles.

Not that any of this should have surprised us. Politico had done an analysis based on hours of statements and confirmed that Trump lies every 5 minutes.

One of his biggest whoppers: "Mexico will 'pay' for the wall. 100%" which apparently is now "through a complicated mechanism and utilizing different definitions of payment, Mexico will 'contribute' to the wall". (Paul Ryan and Trump)

Yet another version of "Alternative facts"...

Trump, unelected by the the majority of voters in the United States, is a fraud, a liar and a disaster.  Forced to deal with an irrational, narcissistic leader (Trump), even Mexico is now taking a hard line with the U.S.  I wonder what new "executive order" Mr. Trump will sign tomorrow?  Less than a week into his administration, he has shown his strategy to remain in office - pander to big business - but offer no substance; abuse the power of his office by calling for an investigation into "fraudulent voting", but don't investigate Russian hacking.  The emperor truly has no clothes.  Small hands.  Big lies.  Totally embarrassing.  You're fired!!

If Trump and his supporters are so sure that Mexico will pay for the wall, i suggest the government issue bonds to finance the wall, payable solely out of funds collected from Mexico. Supporters/believers can purchase the bonds and the rest of us who object to the whole idea can watch. Mr. President, if you are so sure Mexico will pay, here's your chance to step up and walk the walk. We're watching.

"Ok, Mexico, here's the deal. We buy a sombrero and a blanket for 20 billion. You pay 20 billion for a wall."
"Well, Senior Trump, you drive a very hard bargain, but we could consider that if you let our people supply the labor."
"Deal."
"Senior Trump, you are the toughest negotiator we have ever dealt with. You have humbled us and put us in our place."
Yep.  Trump could do that.

Mr. Pena Nieto should cancel his meeting and be the first world leader to refuse to be bullied. No dignity in the office when there is no dignity in the man. Trump will turn our great country into a laughingstock.
Well, I would.

Remember the Alabama anti-illegals legislation of a year or so ago? It was very quietly repealed within a month after passing when Alabama's agri-business couldn't get enough "legal" laborers to do the scut work entailed in growing food for America's tables.

I suspect Alabama is NOT an isolated case.

See also: the restaurant business, the hospitality industry, the apparel industry, etc.

Cheap goods and low wage labor have a cost.

And elections have consequences...

The American consumer cannot be let off the hook, when it seems that they have "total allegiance", to borrow a turn of phrase, to low prices. Those 69¢/lb chicken legs come at a cost, both economic and human. It's not as if those workers are treated well.

pay real wages and people will do the job -- simple enough. If i offer a painter $100 to paint my house he won't show up if i offer $5000 to paint my house many painters will show up. Not hard to grasp. All this so called cheap labor is not so cheap when you take into account the costs of subsidizing medicine, schools, infrastructure for individuals who have families kids are illegal and don't pay payroll taxes. If the price of my groceries go up by .25 cents a pound so be it don't care.

These businesses should not depend on an exploited underclass in order to function. Some years ago, we discovered that many wal-mart and McDonald's employers relied on food stamps to supplement their incomes. In part, this resulted in "fight for $15". The restaurants and agri-businesses need to also pay reasonable wages.
American workers have no choice- Trump has said he will make them pay for it. And they will, because they can't afford to have been wrong about Trump.

After all the nationalistic, populistic rhetoric and pomp fed to the electorate, the American consumer is the ultimate underwriter and payor of a tax arriving in the form of higher priced imported goods, in exchange for nothing more than a colossal monument to the massive ego of a narcissistic ninny.

We need border security. Whether or not Mexico pays for the wall, we need to be able to control our borders.
Trump campaigned on this issue. This is not a surprise to anyone.

Then enforce the laws on the books and get businesses, both big and small to stop hiring illegals. Very simple. Except it's never happened and won't ever happen. Politicians won't do it and Trump especially won't. The wall is not the answer. Getting businesses to not break the law is. But I wonder if folks here would like the outcome of that in terms of what they pay for food, services, etc. And Margo, how about we start seeing how many illegals are working in Trump and Trump associated businesses, hotels, etc?  And did you buy a "real" Made In the US red cap or a Chinese knock-off like my neighbor. Who is sure that Trump is going to make the US great again. So Margo, what's it going to be?
The wall offers no security.  Ladders and tunnels will go right past it.  Most illegals entered legally and overstayed their visas.  What about the Rio Grande, do we wall off our access to it?

comments.userLocation: Under the southern cross, North Island
comments.commentBody: I don't think that a wall provides border security or that this is the best use of taxpayer or Mexican money (and of course they won't pay for it).

I get The Trump Factor and how his boorish behavior is similar to that of a persistent bad smell.
But if millions of people have illegally entered a country in contravention of that countrie's immigration laws, doesn't that country have the right to take a stance to attempt to stop it? How is protecting one's border "an offense to Mexico"
I understand being insulted by Trump's innapropriate and false accusations towards Mexicans and the expectation to make them pay for the wall but not the building of a wall. Are walls and fences that are currently existing insulting too or are only new walls insulting? If the borders are not going to become totally open then reinforcing it might not be a bad thing.

comments.userLocation: Under the southern cross, North Island
comments.commentBody: I think the issue is more complex than a physical barrier can deal with, if it even can. I recommend you read "Masque of the the Red Death."

First, economic studies have shown that illegal immigration is generally helpful to this country.
Also, Obama deported a lot of illegal immigrants. He was known as the Deporter in Chief among Mexicans, I've heard.
Also, do you have reason to believe that a wall is the best way to reduce illegal immigration? Most of the illegal immigrants are people who overstay their visas. So the barriers that we already have for people illegally crossing the border are doing their job.
A fence is a lot cheaper than a wall - is there any reason to believe a wall would work better?
A wall looks more solid and imposing than a fence. Is that why Trump likes the idea? Appearances play a big part in his thinking.
So the objection is that US taxpayers are potentially paying a great deal of money and alienating Mexico for something that wouldn't be helpful to us anyway. There are better uses for that money, like subsidizing people's health insurance.

I have nothing against enforcing our laws against anyone entering into the US illegally. In fact, I support it.

If people want to cross a border, it's been proven that a physical structure doesn't deter them. We would be better off taking those billions of dollars and employing more security personnel.

But no, Trump needs to stroke his ego with something else he can gold-plate or hang a Jumbotron off of...
The Mexican prez has done the right thing. I am flying to Mexico next week to look at property.  I am disgusted with my country.
There are a few million American ex pats in Mexico. Look at the northshore of Lake Chapala, Jalisco.

I just bought a new one, two weeks ago, in the Riviera Maya. 1,300 sq ft, 7-minutes driving/20-block away from the Caribbean Sea, small, tranquil and bohemian town, full of civilized bilingual people from all over the world. Paid less than $70k. Can't wait to get my keys and move out.
Good riddance Freddie.  If Mexico is so wonderful, why would you care if Trump's policies induced more Mexicans to stay in their home country and enjoy richer existences?

The left has a large part in bringing about the atrocity that is President Trump.
I do not agree with his plan to build a wall. I also don't agree that people who overstay their visas or cross the border illegally have the right to be considered American citizens. I live in Seattle currently and our mayor constantly goes on social media making it clear that anyone who does not believe in treating illegal immigrants as legal citizens is unacceptable. He uses words such as diversity and inclusion in ways that don't make sense. The left accuses the right of using dog whistles and racial code words yet the left has consistently used words like diversity, inclusion, racial equity, racism, xenophobia, and sexism in ways that are inherently dishonest and make it taboo to object to their policies. A few weeks ago our mayor pledged a quarter of a million dollars earmarked specifically for the illegal immigrant community. Why are nationals of other countries in America illegally subject to more sympathy and taxpayer funded programs than legal residence?
It is infuriating. If most of these people came from countries where they risk death if they return I would be more compassionate but Mexico is not that bad. Shame on Trump and those who elected him and shame on the left for such tone deaf policies that drove people to vote for him.

The incompetent dems have let down their constituencies. Years of gerry mandering and voter suppression by the repubs and their response has been hand wringing and playing identity politics.Yes, shame on the repubs AND the dems.
The aside from everything else, the wall has environmental implications for migrating animals.

"... aside from everything else, the wall has environmental implications for migrating animals...."

Very true. And even for a person involved with immigrants, the wildlife implications of The Wall are particularly infuriating.

So far Trump has insulted Mexico and China and has probably provoked more instability in the Middle East with his intent to move our embassy to Jerusalem and withdraw from the multi-nation agreement with Iran.
And Trump supporters think we are now more secure?
No. It's missing quite a few things. One of them being subtlety and the other a point.

Tremendous cost with little in return, how about that for a start? Most illegal immigrants, come in on a visa and then overstay. The wall will do nothing to prevent this. It is also a symbol of racism and hatred to our neighbor to the south. They are our third largest trading partner, a relationship that has benefits to both sides.

What if Mexico decides enough insults. Maybe they should form a tighter relationship with China. China thinks that would be a great idea to start expansion into the Northern Hemisphere with their new friend China.

A wall is a stupid idea. Read up on this before thinking this is just about a wall.

@El Lucho What will Republicans do? They will institutionalize their party's governance by restricting access to the ballot box and gerrymandering opposition into a permanent minority. They will impose high political costs on unfavorable reportage ano criticism against them. When necessary, security forces will be used to
